intro: Neobartlettia paezensis, commonly known as the Paez mountain vine, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes plants known for their milky sap and often showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its climbing habit, with opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. It produces distinctive蓇葖 fruits that contain seeds with tufts of hair, aiding in wind dispersal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
